name: RetrieveProjectPlanTaskValues
description:
Retrieve values for project plan tasks in Workday.

Use this tool to get instances that serve as parameter values for project plan tasks in the Workday service.

parameters.name: lookup_effective_date
parameters.description: The effective date to look up time types for a specific worker. Format: YYYY-MM-DD.

value_schema.description: The effective date to look up time types for a given worker.

parameters.name: maximum_response_objects
parameters.description: Set the maximum number of project plan task instances returned in a response. Defaults to 1000.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: response_start_index
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in the response. Use with 'limit' for pagination.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The Workday ID of a project to filter project plan tasks.

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of a project, used to filter the projectPlanTasks resource down to project plan tasks from a given project.

parameters.name: worker_id
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the worker to look up time types for.

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of the worker to look up time types for.

parameters.name: return_in_out_time_entry_codes_only
parameters.description: Set to true to return only Time Entry Codes of the type In/Out. Use these with POST Time Clock Event.

value_schema.description: If true, returns only Time Entry Codes of the type In/Out. You must use these types with POST Time Clock Event.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Workday API

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The effective date to look up time types for a given worker.

value_schema.description: The effective date to look up time types for a given worker.

parameters.name: inOutCodeOnly
parameters.description: If true, returns only Time Entry Codes of the type In/Out. You must use these types with POST Time Clock Event.

value_schema.description: If true, returns only Time Entry Codes of the type In/Out. You must use these types with POST Time Clock Event.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The Workday ID of a project, used to filter the projectPlanTasks resource down to project plan tasks from a given project.

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of a project, used to filter the projectPlanTasks resource down to project plan tasks from a given project.

parameters.name: worker
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the worker to look up time types for.

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of the worker to look up time types for.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
